meanings.sent1: I added some fresh kayle to the salad for extra crunch.
meanings.sent2: The farmer harvested a bunch of kayle from his garden.
meanings.sent3: The kayle rolled off the table and onto the floor, making a mess.
meanings.sent4: The vibrant green color of the kayle reminded me of a lush forest.
meanings.sent5: The smell of cooking kayle filled the kitchen with a pleasant aroma.

meanings.sent1: We had a fun time playing kayle with our friends at the park.
meanings.sent2: The children set up the kayle pins and took turns rolling the ball.
meanings.sent3: During the kayle game, Sarah accidentally knocked down all the pins with one throw.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the ball hitting the kayle pins echoed through the room.
meanings.sent5: The competitive spirit was high as everyone aimed to win at kayle.

meanings.definition: To play the game of kayles.
meanings.sent1: Let's go outside and kayle in the backyard.
meanings.sent2: They kayled for hours, enjoying the friendly competition.
meanings.sent3: After work, John likes to relax by kayling with his coworkers.
meanings.sent4: The children kayled joyfully, laughing and cheering each other on.
meanings.sent5: Kayling together brought the family closer and created lasting memories.
